00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the NeighbourHood class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __NEIGHBOURLIST_HPP
00019 #define __NEIGHBOURLIST_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <memory.hpp>
00022 #include <types.hpp>
00023 #include <neighbour.hpp>
00024 
00025 /// A list of Neighbours.
00026 /**
00027  * This implements a doubly linked list.
00028  * Though, it could be replaced by any other implementation (raw array, tree set, etc.), as long as it has the same public interface.
00029  * 
00030  * \todo Add documentation and some examples.
00031  */
00032 class NeighbourHood {
00033     
00034     protected:
00035         
00036         struct NeighbourHoodElement {
00037             Neighbour neighbour;
00038             NeighbourHoodElement * next;
00039             NeighbourHoodElement * previous;
00040             inline NeighbourHoodElement(MachineId const & id, Size imports) : neighbour(id,imports), next(0), previous(0) {}
00041         };
00042         
00043         NeighbourHoodElement * first;
00044         NeighbourHoodElement * last;
00045         
00046         Size list_size;
00047         
00048         Size imports;
00049         
00050     public:
00051         
00052         class iterator {
00053             protected:
00054                 NeighbourHoodElement * element;
00055                 inline iterator(NeighbourHoodElement * element) : element(element) {}
00056                 friend class const_iterator;
00057                 friend class NeighbourHood;
00058             public:
00059                 inline iterator() {}
00060                 inline iterator & operator ++ (     ) {                     element = element->next    ; return *this; }
00061                 inline iterator   operator ++ (int x) { iterator i = *this; element = element->next    ; return  i   ; }
00062                 inline iterator & operator -- (     ) {                     element = element->previous; return *this; }
00063                 inline iterator   operator -- (int x) { iterator i = *this; element = element->previous; return  i   ; }
00064                 inline Neighbour & operator *  () const { return   element->neighbour ; }
00065                 inline Neighbour * operator -> () const { return &(element->neighbour); }
00066                 inline bool operator == (iterator const & i) const { return element == i.element; }
00067                 inline bool operator != (iterator const & i) const { return element != i.element; }
00068                 inline operator Neighbour * () const { return &(element->neighbour); }
00069         };
00070         
00071         class const_iterator {
00072             protected:
00073                 NeighbourHoodElement const * element;
00074                 inline const_iterator(NeighbourHoodElement const * element) : element(element) {}
00075                 inline const_iterator(iterator const & i) : element(i.element) {}
00076                 friend class NeighbourHood;
00077             public:
00078                 inline const_iterator() {}
00079                 inline const_iterator & operator ++ (     ) {                           element = element->next    ; return *this; }
00080                 inline const_iterator   operator ++ (int x) { const_iterator i = *this; element = element->next    ; return  i   ; }
00081                 inline const_iterator & operator -- (     ) {                           element = element->previous; return *this; }
00082                 inline const_iterator   operator -- (int x) { const_iterator i = *this; element = element->previous; return  i   ; }
00083                 inline Neighbour const & operator *  () const { return   element->neighbour ; }
00084                 inline Neighbour const * operator -> () const { return &(element->neighbour); }
00085                 inline bool operator == (const_iterator const & i) const { return element == i.element; }
00086                 inline bool operator != (const_iterator const & i) const { return element != i.element; }
00087                 inline operator Neighbour const * () const { return &(element->neighbour); }
00088         };
00089         
00090         explicit inline NeighbourHood(Size imports = 0) : first(0), last(0), list_size(0), imports(imports) {}
00091         
00092         inline void reset(Size imports){
00093             iterator i = first;
00094             while(i != end()) i = remove(i);
00095             this->imports = imports;
00096         }
00097         
00098         inline       iterator begin()       { return first; }
00099         inline const_iterator begin() const { return first; }
00100         inline       iterator end  ()       { return 0    ; }
00101         inline const_iterator end  () const { return 0    ; }
00102         
00103         inline Neighbour const & operator [] (MachineId const & id) const {
00104             return *find(id);
00105         }
00106         
00107         inline Neighbour & operator [] (MachineId const & id) {
00108             iterator i = find(id);
00109             return *(i == end() ? add(id) : i);
00110         }
00111         
00112         inline iterator find(MachineId const & id) {
00113             for(iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++) if (i->id == id) return i;
00114             return end();
00115         }
00116         
00117         inline const_iterator find(MachineId const & id) const {
00118             for(const_iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++) if (i->id == id) return i;
00119             return end();
00120         }
00121         
00122         inline iterator add(MachineId const & id) {
00123             NeighbourHoodElement * n = Memory<NeighbourHoodElement>::allocate();
00124             new (n) NeighbourHoodElement(id,imports);
00125             if (last) last->next = n;
00126             n->previous = last;
00127             last = n;
00128             if (!first) first = n;
00129             list_size++;
00130             return n;
00131         }
00132         
00133         inline iterator remove(iterator neighbour) {
00134             NeighbourHoodElement * n = neighbour.element;
00135             if (n->previous) n->previous->next = n->next;
00136             if (n->next    ) n->next->previous = n->previous;
00137             if (n == first) first = n->next;
00138             if (n == last ) last  = n->previous;
00139             iterator next = n->next;
00140             n->~NeighbourHoodElement();
00141             Memory<NeighbourHoodElement>::deallocate(n);
00142             list_size--;
00143             return next;
00144         }
00145         
00146         inline Size size () const { return  list_size; }
00147         inline bool empty() const { return !list_size; }
00148         
00149 };
00150 
00151 #endif
